1.1.section: 1. Data description and collection or re-use of existing data
1.1.question: How will new data be collected or produced and/or how will existing data be re-used?

1.2.section: 1. Data description and collection or re-use of existing data
1.2.question: What data (for example the types, formats, and volumes) will be collected or produced?

2.1.question: What metadata and documentation (for example methodology or data collection and way of organising data) will accompany data?

2.2.question: What data quality control measures will be used?

3.1.section: 3. Storage and backup during the research process
3.1.question: How will data and metadata be stored and backed up during the research process?

3.2.section: 3. Storage and backup during the research process
3.2.question: How will data security and protection of sensitive data be taken care of during the research?

4.1.question: If personal data are processed, how will compliance with legislation on personal data and on data security be ensured?

4.2.question: How will other legal issues, such as intelectual property rights and ownership, be managed? What legislation is applicable?

5.1.question: How and when will data be shared? Are there possible restrictions to data sharing or embargo reasons?

5.2.question: How will data for preservation be selected, and where will data be preserved long-term (for example a data repository or archive)?

5.3.question: What methods or software tools will be needed to access and use the data?

5.4.question: How will the application of a unique and persistent identifier (such us a Digital Object Identifier (DOI)) to each data set be ensured?

6.1.question: Who (for example role, position, and institution) will be responsible for data management (i.e the data steward)?

6.2.question: What resources (for example financial and time) will be dedicated to data management and ensuring the data will be FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Re-usable)?

_unconnected_text.text:
We will document more metadata than needed for reproducibility. We will use README files to document data origin and generation/processing steps Description of our folder organisation :
Project_name/Exp_name/Date/sample_name.txt. The data will be produced in the course of measurements and experimental procedures. The naming of files and catalogs will be standardized. Selected data generated from experiments will be deposited in open research data repository system MOST Danych (Bridge of Data) with general metadata standards, eg. DataCite. Metadata descriptions will be stored in the JSON-D format. Authors will be identified and authorised by ORCID number.
Stosowane środki kontroli jakości danych

Standard protocols will be optimized and used to collect data, to ensure they are reliable and consistent and will scrutinized. All biological experiments will incorporate appropriate positive and negative controls and will be repeated at least 3 times to ensure validity. The data will be recorded by the qualified personnel adequately trained to ensure generation of high quality data. Reagents and solvents with the high purity will be used and the laboratory equipment will be calibrated according to the working time and manufacturer's guidelines. The data will be catalogued in a standardized way fulfilling the requirements of FAIR standards.
Przechowywanie i tworzenie kopii zapasowych danych i metadanych podczas badań

All laboratory experimental details and data will be recorded daily, dated in dedicated laboratory notebooks.Electronic records of the collected data will be created and saved on the Principal Investigator's main computer, with automatic daily backups. An additional copy of each data file will be saved weekly on an external offline drive and in the university's internal cloud storage service, which ensures regular backups and provides appropriate security measures in compliance with applicable data protection standards.
Sposób zapewnienia bezpieczeństwa danych oraz ochrony danych wrażliwych podczas badań

Data will be safeguarded by the following measures: 1. Access to electronic data, prior to their publication, will be limited to the members of the research team by restricted access to desktops (access protected with strong passwords). Members of the research team will lock their desktops whenever they are away from it. 2. Access to laboratories and offices is controlled by the general security system.
Sposób zarządzania innymi kwestiami prawnymi, np. prawami własności intelektualnej lub własnością. Obowiązujące przepisy

The ownership and management of any intellectual property developed in the Project remain in Medical University of Gdańsk. The data and results published in open access scheme will have one of the Creative Commons licences CC BY. Applicable regulations: Resolution of the Senate of Gdańsk University of Technology No. 117/2021/XXV, dated May 19, 2021, Regulations for the Management and Commercialization of Intellectual Property at Gdańsk University of Technology; Resolution No. 48/2017 of the Senate of the Medical University of Gdańsk dated November 27, 2017, on the adoption of the Regulations for the management of copyright and related rights, industrial property rights, and the principles of commercialization at the Medical University of Gdańsk.
Sposób i termin udostępnienia danych. Ewentualne ograniczenia w udostępnianiu danych lub przyczyny embarga

Most of the data generated during project execution will be stored in the institution (GUT) open research data repository MOST Danych (Bridge of Data). The part of the data will be published in Open Access journals, as soon as they are collected and processed appropriatelly to ensure their publication in a scientific journal. There are not any restrictions to data sharing, except for some delay in situation(s) when it is necessary to ensure novelty for publication or when appropriate, to protect IP. The data will be stored for 10 years. They will be made available in the repository no later than at the time of publication.
Sposób wyboru danych przeznaczonych do przechowania oraz miejsce długotrwałego przechowywania danych (np. repozytorium lub archiwum danych)

Most Danych (Bridge of Data) will be the main data repository. Data selected for deposition in repository will be chosen on the basis of scientific quality and good exemplarity. The data provided in the repository will fulfill FAIR requirements and will be categorised and labeled according to the standard file formats.
Metody lub narzędzia programowe umożliwiające dostęp do danych i korzystanie z danych
Data deposited in the open repository Most danych (Bridge of Data) will be in open formats.
Sposób zapewniający stosowanie unikalnego i trwałego identyfikatora (np. cyfrowego identyfikatora obiektu (DOI)) dla każdego zestawu danych
Datasets provided in the repository will have DOI assigned
Osoba (np. funkcja, stanowisko i instytucja) odpowiedzialna za zarządzanie danymi (np. data steward)

Open Science Competence Center (pg.edu.pl/openscience) established at GUT will be responsible for DMP, data storage and dissemination. Principal investigator (Kamila Rząd) will be responsible for procedures' assessment and overall data quality.
Środki (np. finansowe i czasowe) przeznaczone do zarządzania danymi i zapewnienia możliwości odnalezienia, dostępu, interoperacyjności i ponownego wykorzystania danych
Cost of data storage and preservation will be covered from the GUT statutory funds. Costs of Open Access publications will be covered from grant budget.
